name: Raw Fermented Beets
author: Magpie
summary: The health benefits of fermented foods are well established, and they're tasty to boot! If you're lucky enough to have a bumper crop of beets, try this easy recipe. Once beets are fermented, store in the refrigerator for up to 3 months.
ingredients: 2 pounds beets, peeled and cut into chunks
directions: Distribute beet chunks between two jars with lids
Add 2 cloves garlic, 3 peppercorns, and 1 bay leaf to each jar
Combine water and salt in a bowl to make the brine; stir until salt is completely dissolved
Pour enough brine into the jars to completely cover the beets
Screw on lids and let jars sit at room temperature until foam starts to appear on top, about 1 week
Transfer jars to a cool place (50 degrees F, 10 degrees C) for 2 to 3 days after foam appears
